summary.long: Job is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one who feared God and eschewed evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His substance also was seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred sheasses, and a very great household, so that this man was the greatest of all the men of the East.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his sons went and feasted in their houses, every one his day, and sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was so, that when the days of their feasting were ended, Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning and offered burnt offerings according to the number of them all; for Job said, “It may be that my sons have sinned and cursed God in their hearts.” Thus did Job continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan also came among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Satan, “From whence comest thou?” Then Satan answered the Lord and said, “From going to and fro on the earth, and from walking up and down upon it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Satan, “Hast thou considered My servant Job, that there is none like him on the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one who feareth God and escheweth evil?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan answered the Lord and said, “Doth Job fear God for nought?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast not Thou made a hedge about him and about his house, and about all that he hath on every side? Thou hast blessed the work of his hands, and his substance hath increased in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But put forth Thine hand now and touch all that he hath, and he will curse Thee to Thy face!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Satan, “Behold, all that he hath is in thy power; only upon himself put not forth thine hand.” So Satan went forth from the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there came a messenger unto Job and said, “The oxen were plowing and the asses feeding beside them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Sabeans fell upon them and took them away. Yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword, and I only have escaped alone to tell thee!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking, there came also another and said, “The fire of God hath fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep and the servants, and consumed them; and I only have escaped alone to tell thee!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking, there came also another and said, “The Chaldeans made up three bands, and fell upon the camels and have carried them away, yea, and have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only have escaped alone to tell thee!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking, there came also another and said, “Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men, and they are dead; and I only have escaped alone to tell thee!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job arose, and rent his mantle and shaved his head, and fell down upon the ground and worshiped,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return thither. The Lord gave, and the Lord hath taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all this Job sinned not, nor charged God foolishly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan came also among them to present himself before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Satan, “From whence comest thou?” And Satan answered the Lord and said, “From going to and fro on the earth, and from walking up and down upon it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Satan, “Hast thou considered My servant Job, that there is none like him on the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one who feareth God and escheweth evil? And still he holdeth fast his integrity, although thou movedst Me against him to destroy him without cause.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Satan answered the Lord and said, “Skin for skin, yea, all that a man hath will he give for his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But put forth Thine hand now and touch his bone and his flesh, and he will curse Thee to Thy face!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto Satan, “Behold, he is in thine hand; only spare his life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So went Satan forth from the presence of the Lord, and smote Job with sore boils from the sole of his foot unto his crown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took him a potsherd with which to scrape himself, and he sat down among the ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said his wife unto him, “Dost thou still retain thine integrity? Curse God, and die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto her, “Thou speakest as one of the foolish women speaketh. What? Shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil?” In all this did not Job sin with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Job’s three friends heard of all this evil that had come upon him, they came every one from his own place: Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite.For they had made an appointment together to come to mourn with him and to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they lifted up their eyes afar off and knew him not, they lifted up their voice and wept; and they rent every one his mantle, and sprinkled dust upon their heads toward heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sat down with him upon the ground seven days and seven nights, and none spoke a word unto him; for they saw that his grief was very great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this opened Job his mouth and cursed his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job spoke and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, ‘There is a manchild conceived.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, let that night be solitary; let no joyful voice come therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why died I not from the womb? Why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did the knees precede me, or why the breasts that I should suck?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept; then would I have been at rest
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with kings and counselors of the earth, who built desolate places for themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or as a hidden untimely birth I would not have been, as infants who never saw light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the wicked cease from troubling, and there the weary be at rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The small and great are there, and the servant is free from his master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who long for death but it cometh not, and dig for it more than for hidden treasures;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who rejoice exceedingly, and are glad when they can find the grave?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If we attempt to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? But who can withhold himself from speaking?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy words have upheld him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? Or where were the righteous cut off?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity and sow wickedness reap the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of His nostrils are they consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions are broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion’s whelps are scattered abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fear came upon me and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof; an image was before mine eyes. There was silence and I heard a voice, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Shall mortal man be more just than God? Shall a man be more pure than his Maker?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, He put no trust in His servants, and His angels He charged with folly:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, who are crushed before the moth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are destroyed from morning to evening; they perish for ever without any regarding it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth not their excellence which is in them go away? They die, even without wisdom.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have seen the foolish taking root, but suddenly I cursed his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His harvest the hungry eateth up and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He doeth great things and unsearchable, marvelous things without number:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to set up on high those that are low, that those who mourn may be exalted to safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness, and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope in the noonday as in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He saveth the poor from the sword, from the mouth and from the hand of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth; therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He maketh sore, and bindeth up; He woundeth, and His hands make whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall deliver thee in six troubles; yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In famine He shall redeem thee from death, and in war from the power of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue, neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh; neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field, and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt come to thy grave at a full age, as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, this we have searched out; so it is. Hear it, and know thou it for thy good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Job answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Oh that my grief were thoroughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea; therefore my words are swallowed up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me; the poison thereof drinketh up my spirit; the terrors of God set themselves in array against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? Or loweth the ox over his fodder?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can that which is unsavory be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my distressing meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Oh that I might have my request, and that God would grant me the thing that I long for:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even that it would please God to destroy me, that He would let loose His hand and cut me off!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow. Let Him not spare, for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is my strength, that I should hope? And what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is my strength the strength of stones? Or is my flesh of brass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not my help in me? And is wisdom driven quite from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To him that is afflicted, pity should be shown by his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When in time they wax warm, they vanish; when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing and perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The troops of Tema looked; the companies of Sheba waited for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither and were ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down and are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I say, ‘Bring unto me’? or, ‘Give a reward for me of your substance’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or, ‘Deliver me from the enemy’s hand’? or, ‘Redeem me from the hand of the mighty’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teach me, and I will hold my tongue; and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How forceful are right words! But what doth your arguing reprove?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Return, I pray you, let there be no iniquity; yea, return again; my righteousness is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there iniquity on my tongue? Cannot my taste discern perverse things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is there not an appointed time for man upon earth? Are not his days also like the days of a hireling?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as a hireling looketh for the reward of his work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I lie down, I say, ‘When shall I arise and the night be gone?’ And I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and has become loathsome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, and are spent without hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O remember that my life is wind; mine eye shall no more see good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more; Thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away, so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I will not restrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I a sea, or a whale, that Thou settest a watch over me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I say, ‘My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Thou scarest me with dreams and terrifiest me through visions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that my soul chooseth strangling, and death rather than my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I loathe it; I would not live always. Let me alone, for my days are vanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What is man, that Thou shouldest magnify him, and that Thou shouldest set Thine heart upon him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that Thou shouldest visit him every morning, and try him every moment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long wilt Thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sinned. What shall I do unto Thee, O Thou preserver of men? Why hast Thou set me as a mark against Thee, so that I am a burden to myself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why dost Thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity? For now shall I sleep in the dust, and Thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I shall not be.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long wilt thou speak these things? And how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth God pervert judgment? Or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thy children have sinned against Him and He have cast them away for their transgression,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if thou wouldest seek unto God speedily and make thy supplication to the Almighty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if thou wert pure and upright, surely now He would awake for thee and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For inquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself for the searching of their fathers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we are but of yesterday and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall not they teach thee and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can the rush grow up without mire? Can the reed grow without water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whilst it is yet in his greenness and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite’s hope shall perish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose hope shall be cut off and whose trust shall be a spider’s web.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand; he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, ‘I have not seen thee.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, this is the joy of His way, and out of the earth shall others grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will He help the evildoers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: till He fill thy mouth with laughing and thy lips with rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame, and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I know in truth it is so, but how should man be just before God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he will contend with Him, he cannot answer Him one in a thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against Him and hath prospered—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who removeth the mountains, and they know not; Who overturneth them in His anger;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who commandeth the sun, and it riseth not, and sealeth up the stars;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who maketh Arcturus, Orion and Pleiades, and the chambers of the south;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who doeth great things past finding out, yea, and wonders without number?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, He goeth by me, and I see Him not; He passeth on also, but I perceive Him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, He taketh away. Who can hinder Him? Who will say unto him, ‘What doest Thou?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If God will not withdraw His anger, the proud helpers do stoop under Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less shall I answer Him, and choose out my words to reason with Him—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer, but I would make supplication to my Judge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had called and He had answered me, yet would I not believe that He had hearkened unto my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will not suffer me to take my breath, but filleth me with bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I speak of strength, lo, He is strong; and if of judgment, who shall set me a time to plead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me; if I say, ‘I am perfect,’ it shall also prove me perverse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though I were perfect, yet would I not know my soul; I would despise my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is all one thing. Therefore I said it: ‘He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the scourge slay suddenly, He will laugh at the trial of the innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked. He covereth the faces of the judges thereof. If not, where and who is He?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now my days are swifter than a courier; they flee away, they see no good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are passed away as the swift ships, as the eagle that hasteneth to the prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I say, ‘I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness and comfort myself,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid of all my sorrows; I know that Thou wilt not hold me innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I be wicked, why then labor I in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I wash myself with snow water and make my hands never so clean,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet shalt Thou plunge me in the ditch, and mine own clothes shall abhor me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He is not a man as I am, that I should answer Him and we should come together in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither is there any mediator between us who might lay his hand upon us both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Him take His rod away from me, and let not fear of Him terrify me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then would I speak and not fear Him, but it is not so with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will say unto God: ‘Do not condemn me; show me why Thou contendest with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it good unto Thee that Thou shouldest oppress, that Thou shouldest despise the work of Thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast Thou eyes of flesh, or seest Thou as man seeth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are Thy days as the days of man? Are Thy years as man’s days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Thou inquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou knowest that I am not wicked, and there is none that can deliver out of Thine hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet Thou dost destroy me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember, I beseech Thee, that Thou hast made me as the clay. And wilt Thou bring me into dust again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast Thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast protected me with bones and sinews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast granted me life and favor, and Thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And these things hast Thou hid in Thine heart; I know that this is with Thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I sin, then Thou markest me, and Thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I be wicked, woe unto me! And if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see Thou mine affliction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion, and again Thou showest Thyself marvelous upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou renewest Thy witnesses against me, and increasest Thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why then hast Thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not my days few? Cease then and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: before I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land of darkness, as darkness itself, and of the shadow of death without any order, and where the light is as darkness.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Should not the multitude of words be answered? And should a man full of talk be justified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should thy lies make men hold their peace? And when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou hast said, ‘My doctrine is pure, and I am clean in Thine eyes.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But oh, that God would speak and open His lips against thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that He would show thee the secrets of wisdom, that they are double to that which is! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Canst thou by searching find out God? Canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is as high as heaven: What canst thou do? Deeper than hell: What canst thou know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If He cut off, and shut up, or gather together, then who can hinder Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He knoweth vain men; He seeth wickedness also. Will He not then consider it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For vain man would be wise, though man be born like a wild ass’s colt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If thou prepare thine heart, and stretch out thine hands toward Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be steadfast and shalt not fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because thou shalt forget thy misery, and remember it as waters that pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thine age shall be clearer than the noonday; thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; yea, many shall make suit unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, and they shall not escape; and their hope shall be as the giving up of the ghost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you; yea, who knoweth not such things as these?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am as one mocked by his neighbor, who calleth upon God, and He answereth him; the just and upright man is laughed to scorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure, into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee; and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the Lord hath wrought this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth not the ear test words, and the mouth taste his meat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the ancient is wisdom, and in length of days, understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “With Him are wisdom and strength; He hath counsel and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, He breaketh down, and it cannot be built again; He shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, He withholdeth the waters, and they dry up; also He sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With Him are strength and wisdom; the deceived and the deceiver are His.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He leadeth counselors away despoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He leadeth princes away despoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He removeth away the speech of the trusted, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them; He enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They grope in the dark without light, and He maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lo, mine eye hath seen all this; mine ear hath heard and understood it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What ye know, the same do I know also; I am not inferior unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye are forgers of lies; ye are all physicians of no value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O that ye would altogether hold your peace, and it should be your wisdom!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will ye speak wickedly for God, and talk deceitfully for Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will ye accept His person; will ye contend for God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it good that He should search you out? Or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall not His excellency make you afraid, and His dread fall upon you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hold your peace; let me alone that I may speak, and let come on me what will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though He slay me, yet will I trust in Him; but I will argue mine own ways before Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also shall be my salvation, for a hypocrite shall not come before Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold now, I have prepared my cause; I know that I shall be justified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is he that will plead with me? For now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Only do not two things unto me; then will I not hide myself from Thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Withdraw Thine hand far from me, and let not Thy dread make me afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then call Thou, and I will answer; or let me speak, and answer Thou me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How many are mine iniquities and sins? Make me to know my transgression and my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why hidest Thou Thy face, and holdest me for Thine enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt Thou break a leaf driven to and fro? And wilt Thou pursue the dry stubble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; Thou settest a mark upon the heels of my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is motheaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Man that is born of a woman is of few days and full of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down; he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And dost Thou open Thine eyes upon such a one, and bringest me into judgment with Thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? Not one!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with Thee; Thou hast appointed his bounds, that he cannot pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn from him, that he may rest, till, as a hireling, he shall accomplish his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is hope for a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet through the scent of water it will bud and bring forth boughs like a plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But man dieth and wasteth away; yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so man lieth down and riseth not; till the heavens be no more they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O that Thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that Thou wouldest keep me secret until Thy wrath be past; that Thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man die, shall he live again? All the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt call, and I will answer Thee; Thou wilt desire the work of Thine hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now Thou numberest my steps; dost Thou not watch over my sin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and Thou sewest up mine iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters wear away the stones; Thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth, and Thou destroyest the hope of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth; Thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons come to honor, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should he reason with unprofitable talk, or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I; yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Art thou the first man that was born? Or wast thou made before the hills?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou heard the secret of God? And dost thou withhold wisdom for thyself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What knowest thou, that we know not? What understandest thou, which is not in us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are the consolations of God small with thee? Is there any secret thing with thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why doth thine heart carry thee away, and what do thine eyes wink at,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is man, that he should be clean? And he that is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, He putteth no trust in His saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in His sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much more abominable and filthy is man, who drinketh iniquity like water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will show thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what wise men have told from their fathers and have not hid it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto whom alone the earth was given and no stranger passed among them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A dreadful sound is in his ears; in his prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, ‘Where is it?’ He knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready for the battle:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he runneth upon Him, even on His neck, with the thick bosses of his bucklers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he covereth his face with his fatness and maketh dollops of fat on his flanks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he dwelleth in desolate cities and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue; neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of His mouth shall he go away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity, for vanity shall be his recompense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They conceive evil and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have heard many such things; miserable comforters are ye all!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall vain words have an end? Or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also could speak as ye do; if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should assuage your grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Though I speak, my grief is not assuaged; and though I forbear, what am I eased?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now He hath made me weary; Thou hast made desolate all my company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me; and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me; he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder; he hath also taken me by my neck and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His archers compass me round about; he cleaveth my reins asunder and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He breaketh me with breach upon breach; he runneth upon me like a giant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have sewn sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not for any injustice in mine hands; also my prayer is pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My friends scorn me, but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O, that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbor!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a few years have come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My spirit is spent, my days are extinct, the grave is ready for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are there not mockers with me? And doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lay it down now, give me a surety with Thee. Who is he that will strike hands with me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Thou hast hid their heart from understanding; therefore shalt Thou not exalt them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that speaketh flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetime I was as a drum to beat on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upright men shall be astonished at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous also shall hold to his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But as for you all, do ye return and come now, for I cannot find one wise man among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They change the night into day; the light is short because of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I wait, the grave is mine house; I have made my bed in the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have said to corruption, ‘Thou art my father’; to the worm, ‘Thou art my mother and my sister.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And where is now my hope? As for my hope, who shall see it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? Mark, and afterwards we will speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He teareth himself in his anger. Shall the earth be forsaken for thee? And shall the rock be removed out of his place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The trap shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall devour the strength of his skin; even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his; brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall neither have son nor descendant among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that come after him shall be dismayed at his day, as they that went before were frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These ten times have ye reproached me; ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it be indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with His net.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I cry out because of wrong, but I am not heard; I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath fenced up my way, that I cannot pass, and He hath set darkness in my paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone; and mine hope hath He removed like a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath also kindled His wrath against me, and He counteth me unto Him as one of His enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintances are verily estranged from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me as a stranger; I am an alien in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I entreated him with my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My breath is strange to my wife, though I entreated for the sake of the children of my own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spoke against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All my intimate friends abhorred me, and they whom I loved are turned against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I have escaped with the skin of my teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends, for the hand of God hath touched me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh, that my words were now written! Oh, that they were printed in a book,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they were graven with an iron pen and lead, in the rock for ever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know that my Redeemer liveth, and that He shall stand at the latter day upon the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and though after my skin, worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another, though my reins be consumed within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But should ye say, ‘Why persecute we him?’—seeing the root of the matter is found in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye afraid of the sword; for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for this I make haste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard the rebuke of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Knowest thou not this of old, since man was placed upon earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung; they that have seen him shall say, ‘Where is he?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found; yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye also which saw him shall see him no more, neither shall his place any more behold him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His bones are full of the sin of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: though he spare it and forsake it not, but keep it still within his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet his meat in his stomach is turned; it is the gall of asps within him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again; God shall cast them out of his belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall suck the poison of asps; the viper’s tongue shall slay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which he labored for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down; according to his substance shall the restitution be, and he shall not rejoice therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he hath oppressed and hath forsaken the poor, because he hath violently taken away a house which he built not,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly; he shall not save of that which he desired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fullness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits; every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fury of His wrath upon him, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall flee from the iron weapon, and the bow of steel shall strike him through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is drawn and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall; terrors are upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places; a fire not blown upon shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity, and the earth shall rise up against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The increase of his house shall depart, and his goods shall flow away in the day of His wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Job answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suffer me that I may speak; and after I have spoken, mock on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for me, is my complaint to man? And if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their bull breeds, and faileth not; their cow calveth and casteth not her calf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they say unto God, ‘Depart from us, for we desire not the knowledge of Thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is the Almighty, that we should serve Him? And what profit should we have, if we pray unto Him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, their good is not in their hand; the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! And how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in His anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God layeth up his iniquity for his children; He rewardeth him, and he shall know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Shall any teach God knowledge, seeing He judgeth those that are high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His milk pails are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye say, ‘Where is the house of the prince? And where are the dwelling places of the wicked?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have ye not asked them that go along the way? And do ye not know their tokens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the wicked are reserved for the day of destruction? They shall be brought forth on the day of wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who shall declare his way to his face? And who shall repay him what he hath done?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty that thou art righteous? Or is it gain to Him that thou makest thy ways perfect?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will He reprove thee for fear of thee? Will He enter with thee into judgment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not thy wickedness great, and thine iniquities infinite?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withheld bread from the hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth, and the honorable man dwelt in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or darkness, that thou canst not see, and abundance of waters cover thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is not God in the height of heaven? And behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou sayest, ‘How doth God know? Can He judge through the dark cloud?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thick clouds are a covering to Him, that He seeth not; and He walketh in the circuit of heaven.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who were cut down before their time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who said unto God, ‘Depart from us. And what can the Almighty do to them?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet He filled their houses with good things; but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous see it and are glad, and the innocent laugh them to scorn;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Acquaint now thyself with Him, and be at peace; thereby good shall come unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Receive, I pray thee, the law from His mouth, and lay up His words in thine heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up; thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy gold, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto Him, and He shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee; and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, ‘There is lifting up!’ And He shall save the humble person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall deliver the island of the innocent; and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Even today is my complaint bitter; my stroke is heavier than my groaning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh that I knew where I might find Him, that I might come even to His seat!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would place my cause before Him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would know the words which He would answer me, and understand what He would say unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will He plead against me with His great power? No, but He would put strength in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the righteous might dispute with Him; so should I be delivered for ever from my Judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I go forward, but He is not there, and backward, but I cannot perceive Him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the left hand where He doth work, but I cannot behold Him; He hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He knoweth the way that I take; when He hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My foot hath held His steps; His way have I kept, and not declined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of His lips; I have esteemed the words of His mouth more than my necessary food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He is of one mind, and who can turn Him? And what His soul desireth, even that He doeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He performeth the thing that is appointed for me; and many such things are with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore am I troubled at His presence; when I consider, I am afraid of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I was not cut off before the darkness, neither hath He covered the darkness from my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know Him not, see His days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks and feed thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They drive away the ass of the fatherless; they take the widow’s ox as a pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They turn the needy out of the way; the poor of the earth hide themselves together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, as wild asses in the desert go they forth to their work, rising early for a prey; the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They reap every one his corn in the field, and they gather the vintage of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge from the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who make oil within their walls, and tread their wine presses, and suffer thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out; yet God layeth not folly to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The murderer, rising with the light, killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, ‘No eye shall see me,’ and disguiseth his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the dark they dig through houses which they had marked for themselves in the daytime; they know not the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death; if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed on the earth; he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Drought and heat consume the snow waters; so doth the grave those who have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The womb shall forget him, the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered, and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He evilly treateth the barren that beareth not, and doeth not good to the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He draweth also the mighty with his power; he riseth up, and no man is sure of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though it be given him to be in safety whereon he resteth, yet his eyes are upon their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all others, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar and make my speech worth nothing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Dominion and fear are with Him; He maketh peace in His high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there any number to His armies? And upon whom doth not His light arise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then can man be justified before God? Or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold even to the moon, and it shineth not; yea, the stars are not pure in His sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less man, that is a worm? And the son of man, that is a worm?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Job answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How hast thou helped him that is without power? How savest thou the arm that hath no strength?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How hast thou counseled him that hath no wisdom? And how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom hast thou uttered words? And whose spirit came from thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hell is naked before Him, and destruction hath no covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He bindeth up the waters in His thick clouds, and the cloud is not rent under them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He holdeth back the face of His throne, and spreadeth His cloud upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pillars of heaven tremble, and are astonished at His reproof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He divideth the sea with His power, and by His understanding He smiteth through the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By His Spirit He hath garnished the heavens; His hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, these are parts of His ways, but how little a portion is heard of Him! But the thunder of His power, who can understand?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Job continued his parable and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment, and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while my breath is in me and the spirit of God is in my nostrils,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: my lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God forbid that I should justify you; till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go; my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what is the hope of the hypocrite though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
verses.speaker: Narrator
