verses.text: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? Will he always call upon God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will teach you by the hand of God; that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive from the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword; and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death; and his widows shall not weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though he heap up silver as the dust and prepare raiment as the clay,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he may prepare it, but the just shall put it on and the innocent shall divide the silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered; he openeth his eyes, and he is not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Terrors take hold on him as waters; a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The east wind carrieth him away and he departeth, and as a storm, hurleth him out of his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare; he would eagerly flee out of His hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they refine it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is smelted out of the stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection, the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant, even the waters forgotten by the foot; they are dried up, they are gone away from men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread, and under it is turned up as it were fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stones of it are the place of sapphires, and it hath dust of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture’s eye hath not seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lion’s whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he cutteth out rivers among the rocks, and his eye seeth every precious thing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But where shall wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The deep saith, ‘It is not in me’; and the sea saith, ‘It is not with me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It cannot be gotten for gold; neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx or the sapphire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it; and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No mention shall be made of coral or of pearls, for the price of wisdom is above rubies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it; neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whence then cometh wisdom? And where is the place of understanding—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Destruction and death say, ‘We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God understandeth the way thereof, and He knoweth the place thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to make the weight for the winds, and He weigheth the waters by measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then did He see it and declare it; He prepared it, yea, and searched it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto man He said, ‘Behold, the fear of the Lord: that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Job continued his parable and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Oh, that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when His candle shone upon my head, and when by His light I walked through darkness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young men saw me and hid themselves, and the aged arose and stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes refrained from talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me, and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless and him that had none to help him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me; and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me; my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a father to the poor, and the cause which I knew not I searched out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I broke the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I said, ‘I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Unto me men gave ear and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After my words they spoke not again, and my speech dropped upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they waited for me as for the rain, and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I laughed on them, they believed it not, and the light of my countenance they cast not down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I chose out their way and sat as chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now they that are younger than I hold me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, for what might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From want and famine they were solitary, fleeing into the wilderness, in former time desolate and waste,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who cut up mallow by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were driven forth from among men; they cried after them as after a thief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to dwell in the cliffs of the valleys, in caves of the earth and in the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men; they were viler than the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now am I their song; yea, I am their byword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because He hath loosed my cord and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destructiveness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity; they have no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters; in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Terrors are turned upon me; they pursue my soul as the wind, and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My bones are pierced in me in the night season, and my sinews take no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed; it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I cry unto Thee, and Thou dost not hear me; I stand up, and Thou regardest me not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou art become cruel to me; with Thy strong hand Thou opposest Thyself against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou liftest me up to the wind; Thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know that Thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet He will not stretch out His hand to the grave, though they cry in His destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? Was not my soul grieved for the poor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me; and when I waited for light, there came darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My bowels boiled, and rested not; the days of affliction came upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I went mourning without the sun; I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my flute into the voice of them that weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I made a covenant with mine eyes. Why then should I think upon a maid?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what portion from God is there from above, and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not destruction for the wicked, and a strange punishment for the workers of iniquity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth not He see my ways, and count all my steps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hastened to deceit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let me sow and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If mine heart has been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbor’s door,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let my wife grind for another, and let others bow down upon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is a heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I have despised the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant when they contended with me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what then shall I do when God riseth up? And when He visiteth, what shall I answer Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not He that made me in the womb make him? And did not One fashion us in the womb?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for from my youth he was brought up with me as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother’s womb);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of His highness I could not endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, ‘Thou art my confidence’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge, for I should have denied the God that is above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the men of my tent said not, ‘Oh that we had of his flesh! We cannot be satisfied’.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stranger did not lodge in the street, but I opened my doors to the traveler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence and went not out of the door?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh, that One would hear me! Behold, my desire is that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would declare unto Him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley.” The words of Job are ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram. Against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer and yet had condemned Job.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elihu had waited until Job had spoken, because they were older than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, answered and said: “I am young, and ye are very old; therefore I was afraid, and dared not show you mine opinion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said, ‘Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there is a spirit in man, and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great men are not always wise, neither do the aged understand judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I say, ‘Hearken to me; I also will show mine opinion.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, I attended unto you, and behold, there was none of you that convinced Job or that answered his words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest ye should say, ‘We have found out wisdom. God thrusteth him down, not man.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he hath not directed his words against me, neither will I answer him with your speeches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They were amazed, they answered no more; they left off speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I had waited (for they spoke not, but stood still and answered no more),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said, ‘I will answer also my part; I also will show mine opinion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am full of matters; the spirit within me constraineth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new wineskins.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will speak, that I may be refreshed; I will open my lips and answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man’s person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my Maker would soon take me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches and hearken to all my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, now I have opened my mouth; my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My words shall be from the uprightness of my heart, and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me and stand up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God’s stead, I also am formed out of the clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, terror of me shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am clean, without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, He findeth occasions against me; He counteth me for His enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He putteth my feet in the stocks; He marketh all my paths.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, in this thou art not just; I will answer thee: that God is greater than man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why dost thou strive against Him? For He giveth not account of any of His matters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then He openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that He may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen, and his bones that were not seen stick out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand to show unto man his uprightness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he is gracious unto him and saith, ‘Deliver him from going down to the pit; I have found a ransom.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s; he shall return to the days of his youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall pray unto God, and He will be favorable unto him; and he shall see His face with joy, for He will render unto man His righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looketh upon men, and if any say, ‘I have sinned and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me; hold thy peace, and I will speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me; speak, for I desire to justify thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If not, hearken unto me; hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, Elihu answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us choose for us judgment; let us know among ourselves what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Job hath said, ‘I am righteous, and God hath taken away my judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should I lie against my right? My wound is incurable, without transgression.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he hath said, ‘It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding; far be it from God that He should do wickedness, and from the Almighty that He should commit iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the work of a man shall He render unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath given Him a charge over the earth? Or who hath disposed the whole world?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If He set His heart upon man, if He gather unto Himself his Spirit and his breath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If now thou hast understanding, hear this; hearken to the voice of my words:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall even he that hateth right govern? And wilt thou condemn him that is most just?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it fit to say to a king, ‘Thou art wicked’? And to princes, ‘Ye are ungodly’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less to Him that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor! For they all are the work of His hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away; and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For His eyes are upon the ways of man, and He seeth all his goings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He will not lay upon man more than right, that he should enter into judgment with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore He knoweth their works, and He overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they turned back from Him, and would not consider any of His ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto Him, and He heareth the cry of the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? And when He hideth His face, who then can behold Him, whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only?—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely it is meet to be said unto God, ‘I have borne chastisement; I will not offend any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which I see not, teach Thou me; if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should it be according to thy mind? He will recompense it, whether thou refuse or whether thou choose, and not I; therefore speak what thou knowest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end, because of his answers for wicked men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin; he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elihu spoke moreover and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thinkest thou this to be right that thou saidst, ‘My righteousness is more than God’s’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou saidst, ‘What advantage will it be unto Thee?’ and, ‘What profit shall I have if I be cleansed from my sin?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look unto the heavens and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou sinnest, what doest thou against Him? Or if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou be righteous, what givest thou Him? Or what receiveth He of thine hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry; they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But none saith, ‘Where is God my Maker, who giveth songs in the night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although thou sayest thou shalt not see Him, yet judgment is before Him; therefore trust thou in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, because it is not so, He hath visited in His anger; yet he knoweth it not in his great extremity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elihu also proceeded and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suffer me a little, and I will show thee that I have yet to speak on God’s behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For truly my words shall not be false; He that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, God is mighty and despiseth not any; He is mighty in strength and wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He preserveth not the life of the wicked, but giveth right to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He withdraweth not His eyes from the righteous, but with kings are they on the throne; yea, He doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if they be bound in fetters, and be held in cords of affliction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then He showeth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they obey and serve Him, they shall spend their days in prosperity and their years in pleasures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath; they cry not when He bindeth them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so would He have removed thee out of thy straits into a broad place where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked; judgment and justice take hold on thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because there is wrath, beware lest He take thee away with His stroke; then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will He esteem thy riches? No, not gold nor all the forces of strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed, regard not iniquity, for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, God exalteth by His power. Who teacheth like Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath enjoined Him His way? Or who can say, ‘Thou hast wrought iniquity’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember that thou magnify His work, which men behold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, God is great, and we know Him not; neither can the number of His years be searched out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He maketh small the drops of water; they pour down rain according to the vapor thereof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which the clouds do drop and distill upon man abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of His tabernacle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, He spreadeth His light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by them judgeth He the people; He giveth meat in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With clouds He covereth the light, and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh between.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The noise thereof showeth concerning it; the cattle also, concerning the vapor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear attentively the noise of His voice, and the sound that goeth out of His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and His lightning unto the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After it a voice roareth; He thundereth with the voice of His excellency, and He will not stay them when His voice is heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God thundereth marvelously with His voice; great things doeth He, which we cannot comprehend!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He saith to the snow, ‘Be thou on the earth’; likewise to the small rain and to the great rain of His strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sealeth up the hand of every man, that all men may know His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind, and cold out of the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the breath of God frost is given, and the breadth of the waters is straitened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also by watering He wearieth the thick cloud; He scattereth His bright cloud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it is turned round about by His counsels, that they may do whatsoever He commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He causeth it to come—whether for correction, or for His land, or for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hearken unto this, O Job; stand still and consider the wondrous works of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of His cloud to shine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of Him who is perfect in knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How thy garments are warm, when He quieteth the earth by the south wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou with Him spread out the sky, which is strong and as a molten looking glass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach us what we shall say unto Him, for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall it be told Him that I speak? If a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds, but the wind passeth and cleanseth them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fair weather cometh out of the north; with God is fearsome majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning the Almighty, we cannot find Him out; He is excellent in power and in judgment, and abounding in justice; He will not afflict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men do therefore fear Him; He respecteth not any that are wise of heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? Declare, if thou hast understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? Or who hath stretched the line upon it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? Or who laid the cornerstone thereof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it broke forth as if it had issued out of the womb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when I made the cloud the garment thereof and thick darkness a swaddling band for it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and broke up for it My decreed place, and set bars and doors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further; and here shall thy proud waves be stayed’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days, and caused the dayspring to know his place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is turned as clay under the seal; and they stand out as a garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the wicked their light is withheld, and the high arm shall be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? Or hast thou walked in the search of the depths?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? Or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? Declare if thou knowest it all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Where is the way where light dwelleth? And as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou shouldest take it to the boundary thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born, or because the number of thy days is great?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hast thou entered into the treasure house of the snow, or hast thou seen the treasure house of the hail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to cause it to rain on the earth where no man is, on the wilderness wherein there is no man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to satisfy the desolate and waste ground, and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hath the rain a father? Or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of whose womb came the ice? And the hoary frost of heaven, who hath engendered it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? Or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? Canst thou set the dominion thereof over the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go and say unto thee, ‘Here we are’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts, or who hath given understanding to the heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can stay the bottles of heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion, or fill the appetite of the young lions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they crouch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who provideth for the raven his food, when his young ones cry unto God, and wander for lack of meat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? Or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou number the months that they fulfill? Or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones; they cast out their sorrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their young ones are sturdy; they grow up with corn; they go forth and return not unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who hath sent out the wild ass free? Or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose house I have made the wilderness and the barren land his dwellings?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band to the furrow? Or will he harrow the valleys behind thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou trust him because his strength is great? Or wilt thou leave thy labor to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home the seed and gather it into thy barn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? Or wings and feathers unto the ostrich,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers; her labor is in vain without fear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath He imparted to her understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet when she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hast thou given the horse strength? Hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? The glory of his nostrils is terrible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength; he goeth on to meet the armed men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He mocketh at fear, and is not frightened, neither turneth he back from the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage, neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saith among the trumpets, ‘Ha, ha!’ And he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock and the strong place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her young ones also suck up blood; and where the slain are, there is she.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the Lord answered Job and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct Him? He that reproveth God, let him answer it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered the Lord and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I am vile. What shall I answer Thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once have I spoken, but I will not answer; yea, twice, but I will proceed no further.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered the Lord unto Job out of the whirlwind and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Gird up thy loins now like a man; I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou also disannul My judgment? Wilt thou condemn Me, that thou mayest be righteous?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou an arm like God? Or canst thou thunder with a voice like Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath; and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold now Behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He moveth his tail like a cedar; the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the chief of the ways of God; He that made him can make His sword to approach unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed and fens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he drinketh up a river and hasteneth not; he trusteth that he can draw up the Jordan into his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will any take him with his sight, or bore his nose with a snare?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Canst thou draw out Leviathan with a hook? Or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou put a hook into his nose, or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he make many supplications unto thee? Will he speak soft words unto thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he make a covenant with thee? Wilt thou take him as a servant for ever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? Or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? Shall they parcel him among the merchants?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons, or his head with fish spears?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lay thine hand upon him; remember the battle, and do so no more!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the hope against him is in vain. Shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None is so fierce that dare stir him up. Who then is able to stand before Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath come before Me, that I should repay him? Whatsoever is under the whole heaven is Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can uncover the face of his garment? Or who can come to him with his double bridle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can open the doors of his face? His teeth are terrible round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a tight seal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One is so near to another that no air can come between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are joined one to another; they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By his sneezings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The folds of his flesh are joined together; they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His heart is as firm as a stone, yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid; by reason of breakings they purify themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold the spear, the dart, nor the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The arrow cannot make him flee; slingstones are turned by him into stubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Darts are counted as stubble; he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sharp potsherds are his undersides; he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot; he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He beholdeth all high things; he is a king over all the children of pride.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered the Lord and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I know that Thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withheld from Thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge?’ Therefore have I uttered what I understood not, things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak; I will question thee, and declare thou unto Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard of Thee by the hearing of the ear, but now mine eye seeth Thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was so, that after the Lord had spoken these words unto Job, the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite, “My wrath is kindled against thee and against thy two friends; for ye have not spoken of Me the thing that is right, as My servant Job hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore take unto you now seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to My servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering. And My servant Job shall pray for you; for him will I accept, lest I deal with you after your folly in that ye have not spoken of Me the thing which is right, like My servant Job.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went and did according as the Lord commanded them. The Lord also accepted Job.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord released Job from captivity when he prayed for his friends. Also the Lord gave Job twice as much as he had before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came there unto him all his brethren and all his sisters, and all those who had been of his acquaintance before, and ate bread with him in his house. And they bemoaned him and comforted him over all the evil that the Lord had brought upon him. Every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one an earring of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning; for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand sheasses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had also seven sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the name of the first Jemimah, and the name of the second Keziah, and the name of the third Kerenhappuch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job, and their father gave them an inheritance among their brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Job lived one hundred and forty years, and saw his sons and his sons’ sons, even four generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Job died, being old and full of days.
verses.speaker: Narrator
